meanings.sent1: The insubstantiality of the ghost made it seem transparent.
meanings.sent2: The insubstantiality of the cloud made it difficult to grasp.
meanings.sent3: The insubstantiality of the argument left everyone puzzled.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams felt like insubstantiality, slipping through her fingers.
meanings.sent5: The insubstantiality of the mist created an eerie atmosphere.

meanings.sent1: The insubstantiality of the fabric made it unsuitable for heavy-duty use.
meanings.sent2: She was captivated by the insubstantiality of the music.
meanings.sent3: The insubstantiality of the excuse made her chuckle.
meanings.sent4: His promises were as fleeting as the insubstantiality of smoke.
meanings.sent5: The insubstantiality of the soap bubbles delighted the children.

meanings.sent1: The insubstantiality of the dream made it feel like a distant memory.
meanings.sent2: She marveled at the insubstantiality of the sand slipping through her fingers.
meanings.sent3: The insubstantiality of the plan left them uncertain of its success.
meanings.sent4: The insubstantiality of the reflection in the water puzzled her.
meanings.sent5: The insubstantiality of the mist enveloped the forest in mystery.
